revised_title: Enlarging the Divisions of the Barometer: A New Invention by Robert Hooke
tldr: In 1686, Robert Hooke invented a new way to increase the divisions of the barometer, allowing for more precise measurements of atmospheric pressure. By using colored liquid and a specialized glass design, Hooke's baroscope provided a more accurate and reliable instrument for studying meteorological changes. This invention was a significant step towards developing a more certain and comprehensive understanding of meteorology.
